overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach to short-term forecasting for a time series with clear daily seasonality and limited historical data. The analyst identifies the 24-hour pattern, checks for trends, and selects a simple averaging method due to data constraints. The approach prioritizes robustness over complexity, with detailed manual calculations ensuring transparency.
common_data_patterns: Complete data in the provided segment
key_insights: Limited data (only 4 days) restricts complex model usage like SARIMA
Hourly averaging captures daily patterns effectively when trends are absent
Manual decomposition and pattern repetition simplify forecasting
Data reshaping (4 days Ã— 24 hours) enables efficient hourly averaging
Forecast horizon matches historical seasonality cycle length (96 hours)
complexity_analysis: Moderately detailed with emphasis on data inspection and manual calculations, avoiding advanced statistical models due to data limitations. Focuses on practical, explainable heuristics.
